plan_analysis:
The pre-research context gives only the first three rounds’ results; it does not show the current table, injury/squad news, betting odds, or any quantified historical patterns that link mid-tournament position to the final champion.  
Forecasters still need:

Base rate: How often each nation wins; how often the Round-3 leader goes on to be champion; any comeback patterns.  
Resolution mechanism: Exact tie-break rules used in the official table.  
Key drivers: (1) Current standings/points-difference, (2) Injury or selection news for title contenders, (3) Market-implied probabilities/odds.  
Current state: Up-to-date table, injury updates, bookmaker odds, and previews of Rounds 4-5.  
Contrarian check: Historical examples of late-round turnarounds.

The search plan therefore mixes:
• Five historical queries (base rates, rules, past conversion rates).  
• Three current queries (table, injuries, odds).  
Exactly one Agent query provides a ready-made historical dataset of Round-3 leaders vs. final champions.

queries_planned.intent: Get full list of winners to calculate frequency for each team.

queries_planned.query: Six Nations grand slam by nation
queries_planned.intent: Measure historical dominance and likelihood of an unbeaten run leading to title.

queries_planned.query: Six Nations tie breaker rules points difference
queries_planned.intent: Confirm official resolution mechanism used to rank teams level on match points.

queries_planned.query: Six Nations leader after round 3 champion
queries_planned.intent: Find articles or stats tracking how often mid-tournament leaders win the championship.

queries_planned.query: [Agent] Provide dataset of every Six Nations season 2000-2025: identify the team leading the table after Round 3 and the eventual champion; calculate probability that the Round-3 leader wins and list seasons where another team overtook them.
queries_planned.intent: Produce a precise historical conversion rate for mid-tournament leaders.
Retrieve the latest official standings after the most recent matches.
Gather breaking reports on injuries or squad changes affecting top contenders.
Capture current bookmaker odds/market expectations for each team to win the championship.
